parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To store up, treasure up. From apo and thesaurizo; to treasure away.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Really, truly, actually. Adverb of the oblique cases of on; really.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
